result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy K Gartner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges - Restitution Hrg before Comm Dowse on Count 1.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Sandra Miles or her residence and no contact w/ Steven Kadolph or Christopher Warren, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No contact w/ any individual who uses or traffics controlled substances.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Terry Rose. Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made. 
Count 1 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years Consecutive to Count 4.  Restitution to be determined through a restitution hearing before Comm. Dowse and Conditions are the same as extended supervision in Count 4.  
Count 4 -   Defendant is sentenced to 3 1/2 years in the WSP;  1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 133 days.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. 
No contact with Sandra M., Steven K. or Christopher W unless permitted by the Court.  Court costs & DNA Surcharge ordered in both counts and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Terry Rose.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 2, 3, and 5 - Dismissed on State motion, to be read in.  Counts 1 and 4 - Pleas of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 2/18/16 at 1:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Terry Rose.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Status conf. 1/7/16 at 8:50, to allow time to determine if def. is eligible for Drug Court.  Bond continued.
